title: Introducing: Boys Republic
content:
With a Curtis-esque drawl, Interpol style driven bass-lines and the scything wit more commonly associated with The National, Toronto trio Boys Republic comprised of Ryan Kennedy, Jeremy Boyd and Shawn Bradley may not be 100% unique, but that’s not to say that they don’t bring anything interesting to the table.

Their debut EP Rakish, the first in series of one EP a month this year, is four tracks that form a fitting introduction to the group. It’s a sound that has been mimicked countless times before, but it’s a mighty long time since I remember a group doing it as well as Defamer or Make You Happy. EP highlight Pictures is perhaps let down by low-budget production, yet the songwriting and lyrical ability shown more than makes up for the basic and at-times slightly rigid production. Check out the EP in full below, and grab a free download while you can.
